newsitem.title: USA: US senator urges sanctions on Bow Valley Iran deal.
newsitem.headline: US senator urges sanctions on Bow Valley Iran deal.

text.p: U.S. Sen. Alphonse D'Amato urged the State Department on Wednesday to punish privately-held Canadian firm Bow Valley Energy under the Iran Libya Sanction Act for a deal it signed to develop the Balal oil field in Iran.

"By reportedly signing an oil deal with Iran, Bow Valley has chosen to support international terrorism," said the New York Republican, an architect of the one-year old law designed to deter foreign investment in Iran to make Teheran stop its alleged support of terrorism and pursuit of nuclear weapons.
"I hope that the State Department applies the full measure of sanctions against Bow Valley and any of its partners," he said, calling it a "matter of national security."
Bow Valley Energy last week signed a deal estimated at more than $150 million to develop the Balal offshore oil field over three to four years.

The State Department said it was seeking more information about Bow Valley Energy's agreement. "We will review this information and take whatever action may be appropriate," a State Department spokeswoman said.

Washington has yet to slap sanctions on any company under the Iran Libya Sanctions Act. The law called for the United States to penalize any non-U.S. company that invested $40 million or more in any one year to develop oil or gas in Iran or Libya.
As of Tuesday, the threshold for sanctions involving Iranian investments fell to $20 million under the law, because U.S. allies had failed to join in isolating Iran economically.
